abstract: He paired with George Carlin, was the pompous half of a memorable comedy team with Avery Schreiber and had a second career as a producer and writer.
lead_paragraph: Jack Burns, who found fame as the hilariously pompous half of Burns and Schreiber, one of the best-known comedy teams of the 1960s and â€™70s, then made another mark as a television writer, died on Monday in Toluca Lake, Calif. He was 86.
